availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Burns (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza J. Burns. Father of Nancy J. Burns, William Thomas Burns, Susan E. Burns, Laura F. Burns, Ann E. Burns, John H. Burns, and Vandicy Burns. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1840. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 165.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 70B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 623.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 126B.
